paper.title: Testing for complementarities among countable strategies
paper.abstract: I study whether the pricing strategies of competing duopolists in the early US cellular telephone industry can be considered strategic complements or substitutes. In order to do so, I present a multivariate count data regression model that is suitable to test for the existence of strategic complementarities when firms make use of countable strategies. The estimator, which accommodates the underdispersion that characterizes the data, is shown to have better small-sample properties than common estimators based on the Gaussian copula. It also allows for correlations of any sign among counts independently of the dispersion parameters. Results show that in addition to screening consumers, competing firms imitated each other in the number of tariff options offered to their customers.

domain_result.justification: 该论文主要研究的是竞争性双头垄断市场中企业的定价策略，以及如何通过计数数据回归模型来测试策略互补性或替代性。虽然涉及回归分析技术，但其应用场景是产业经济学中的市场竞争策略分析，而非上述任何特定的金融研究领域。
